question.body: Which of the following types of receptors never act as nociceptors?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Even if the chemical causing tissue damage doesn’t directly stimulate the nociceptor, the chemicals produced by damaged tissue cells will stimulate chemoreceptive nociceptors.

Correct. Even though people can be sensitive to light and feel pain, such as during migraine headache, the photoreceptor is not directly acting as a nociceptor; instead the signal produced in response to light that normally sets the body’s circadian rhythm is stimulating sensitized neurons in the brain that create the perception of pain.
Incorrect. These nociceptors are stimulated by intense mechanical stimulation.
Incorrect. These nociceptors are stimulated by extreme cold or heat stimulation.

part.hint: An external stimulus can be detected by a receptor and make a different nociceptor or neuron more sensitive without directly stimulating the nociceptor itself.
